articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website

articles.title: Welcome.
articles.contents:
I am a third year PhD Student in the  Department of Statistics  at   UC Irvine  .


I am currently working on a dissertation proposal in Bayesian Nonparametrics, under the supervision of   Erik Sudderth   and   Michele Guindani . 


I am interested in applications of statistics to classification tasks, network analysis and recommendation systems. I also enjoy working on projects related to statistical education.


I love learning about other cultures and traveling.

articles.title: About me
articles.contents: The earliest part of my education was humanity-oriented, but I have also always liked math. And I have always loved learning. I found myself enthusiastic of disparate disciplines that I studied along the path (e.g. philosophy, anthropology, contemporary sculpture - but also micro and macroeconomics, public law, game theory). At some point I understood I was best fit for a career in a quantitative field. And after finding Bayesian statistics, I understood that’s the direction I wanted to go.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Contents
Research Interests
Refereed publications
Non-refereed work

Research Interests

I am interested in the development and application of Bayesian Nonparametric models, especially for clustering, analysis of time series and for the modeling of network data. I am currently working on my first research project under the supervision of professors Michele Guindani and Erik Sudderth, and I plan to advance to candidacy by Summer 2022.


Due to my varied background, I am enthusiastic about working with researchers in other fields. So far, I have collaborated with academic projects in the field of Behavioral Sciences (see below) but in the future I would love to contribute to projects in the fields of Anthropology, Economics and Sociology.

Refereed publications
Statistical methodology

   Federica Zoe Ricci, Michele Guindani, Erik Sudderth (in preparation). Thinned random measures for sparse graphs with overlapping communities.

Collaborations in other fields

   Riccardo Migliavada, Federica Zoe Ricci, Luisa Torri (2021).  A three-year longitudinal study on the use of pre-ordering in a university canteen , Appetite


   Riccardo Migliavada, Federica Zoe Ricci, Francesco Denti, Derenik Haghverdian, Luisa Torri (2022). Is purchasing of vegetable dishes affected by organic or local labels? Empirical evidence from a university canteen, Appetite (revise and resubmit))

Non-refereed work
Bayesian Nonparametrics
A Sticky Hierarchical Pitman-Yor Process as a Prior for Hidden Markov Models, MSc Thesis, 2019 advised by Antonio Lijoi, Bocconi University

articles.description:

Tasks
Some examples of the work that I have done:

creating exams, homework and quizzes


preparing detailed answer keys


assigning grades and personalized feedback


holding office hours and lab sessions


maintaining active and regular communication with students


recording and editing educational videos

Tools

Awards

I really enjoy teaching and learning how to improve at teaching.


As a result of my commitment to teaching:

At the end of my first year as a PhD student, I received an honorable mention as best TA of the year in the Department of Statistics at UCI.
In the summer 2020, I was selected for the Division of Teaching Excellence and Innovation Summer Fellowship. As a DTEI fellow, I worked with Dr. Dogucu on remote-learning related topics, such as students’ engagement in remote classes and video editing.
Publications
Refereed articles
